title: Exploring the Concept of Mean Values Based on Learning Trajectories: Application of Social Data Analysis and Strengthening Civic Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of data representation methods in tables and graphs, exposure to basic social statistics concepts (population, economic indicators, cultural metrics, etc.), and understanding of fundamental civic rights
context.additional_context: Lesson design incorporating supplementary learning activities using smart devices in limited-technology environments. Emphasizes project-based learning utilizing community data, focusing on cultivating data literacy and critical analysis skills as citizens. Encourages holistic thinking considering political, economic, and cultural contexts during the learning process

learning_goals: Students analyze various social data representations (tables, graphs) to explain mean calculation principles and enhance their ability to interpret economic and demographic social phenomena.
Learners can categorize the meaning and scope of averages by context (social surveys, policy analysis, civic engagement, etc.) through real-life examples like economic and demographic statistics.
Through collaborative learning activities, learners identify and correct errors in mean derivation processes and cultivate civic competencies by applying them to community problem-solving.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
